gurmukhi: prI mwr buMgM CutI bwx golI ] mno sUr bYTy BlI Kyl holI ]19]
transliteration: Daroo Maar Budgadg Chhoutoo Baan Mano Soor Baithe Bhalikheldholee||19||
translation: Form the hill the bullets and arrows were showered. It seemed that the sun set down after playing a good holi.19.

gurmukhi: igry bIr BUmM srM swNg pylM ] rMgy sROx bsqRM mno Pwg KylM ]
transliteration: Gire Beer Bhooman Saran Saan Pelan|| Rane Sraoun Bastran Mano Phaag Khelan||
translation: Pierced by arrows and spears, the warriors fell in the battlefield. Their clothes were dyed with blood, it seemed that they played holi.

gurmukhi: lIXo jIq bYrI kIAw Awn fyrM ] qyaU jwie pwrM rhy bwir kyrM ]20]
transliteration: Looyo Jeet Bairoo Kooa Aan Deran|| Teoo Jaae Paaran Rahe Daar(i) Deran||20||
translation: After conquering the enemy, they came for rest at heir place of encampment, on the other side of the reiver. 20.

gurmukhi: BeI rwqiR gubwr ky ArD jwmM ] qbY Coirgy bwr dyvY dmwmM ]
transliteration: Bhaoo Raatr(i) Goubaar Ke Ardh Jaamannd|| Tabai Chhodhige Baar Devai Damaamannd||
translation: Sometime after midnight they left, while beating the drums.

gurmukhi: sbY rwqiR bIqI auidE idausrwcxM ] cly bIr cwlwk K`g iKlwxM ]21]
transliteration: Sahai Raatr(i) Bootoo Udio Dious-raanan|| Chale Boor Dhaalaak Khadganng Khilaanan||21||
translation: When the whole night ended and the sun arose, the warriors on out side marched hastily, brandishing their spears.21.

gurmukhi: BijE AlP KwnM n Kwnw sMBwirE ] Bjy Aaur bIrM n DIrM ibcwirE ]
transliteration: Bhajio Alaf Khaanan Na Khaanaa Sanbhaario|| Bhaje Aur Booran Na Dhooran Bichaario||
translation: Alif Khan fled away, leaving back his belongings. All the other warriors fled away and did not stay anywhere.

gurmukhi: ndI pY idnM Ast kIny mukwmM ] BlI BwNiq dyKy sbY rwj DwmM ]22]
transliteration: Nadoo Pai Dinanaan Ast Koone Moukaamannd|| Bhaloo Bhaant(i) Dekhe Sabai Raaj Dhaamannd||22||
translation: I remained there on the bank of the river for eight more days and visited the palaces of all the chiefs.22.

gurmukhi: ieq hm hoie ibdw Gr Awey ] sulh nimq vY auqih isDwey ]
transliteration: It Ham Hoe Bidaa Ghar Aae|| Sulah Namit Vai Outah(i) Sidhaae||
translation: Then I took leave and came home, they went there to settle the terms of peace.

gurmukhi: sMiD ienY aun kY sMig keI ] hyq kQw pUrn ieq BeI ]23]
transliteration: Sandh(i) Inai Oun Kai San(i) Kaoo|| Het Kathaa Pooran It Bhaoo||23||
translation: Both the parties made and agreement, therefore the story ends here.23.

gurmukhi: AwlsUn kh mwir kY ieh idis kIE ipXwn ]
transliteration: Alsoon Kah Daar(i) Kai Eh Dis(i) Ko( i)  Piyaan||
translation: I came to this side after destroying alsun on my way;

gurmukhi: Bwiq Anykn ky kry pur AnMd suK Awn ]24]
transliteration: Bhaat(i) Anekan Ke Dare Pur Anand Souch Aan||24||
translation: And enjoyed in various ways after reaching Anandpur.24.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy ndOn ju`D brnnM nwm nOmo iDAwie smwpq msqu suB msqu ]9]344]
transliteration: It(i) Sri Bachitra Naatak Granthe Nadaoun Juddh Barnanan Naam Naoumo Dhiaae Samaapat Mast(u) Soubh Mast(u)||9||afjoo||344||
translation: End of Ninth Chapter of BACHITTAR NATAK entitled â€˜Description of the battle of Nadaun.9.344.
